utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We’ll give it to him now, before the fat starts dripping out his eyeballs.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Hey! My fingers are numb!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your watch is on too tight.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You’re messing with my head.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your relationship with your dad is messing with your ability to do your job.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Only because you made my dad part of my job.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good point. Haven’t seen him in years, he flies across the Atlantic to see you –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pacific.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You breeze by him like he’s a Hare Krishna at the airport. You don’t even ask why he’s in town.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It’s probably a conference.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably. I was hoping to do this by sheer manipulation, but if you insist on talking, fine, talk. What did he do to you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How would you feel if I interfered in your personal life?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’d hate it. That’s why I cleverly have no personal life.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’m going to biopsy his skin lesions.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good thinking! Prove your dad wrong. That’ll solve everything.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Who extubated him?

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: I did. Temperature’s down two degrees and the swelling’s almost gone.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: And his skin looks better, too.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: The cytoxan is working.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Feeling better, Gabe?

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: Yup, a lot.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Dr. Chase, can you and I have a word?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Your diagnosis is wrong. No auto-immune disease. The swelling’s probably just down because we’ve got him on steroids. It’s masking whatever’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: ANAs are unreliable.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Phospholipid antibodies are negative, so no lupus. Same for Churg-Strauss.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: You’re arguing with a rheumatologist. There’s about twenty distinct auto-immune diseases –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: SLE conference.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You were in New York last year for the scleroderma conference, I didn’t hear anything from you.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Just wanted to say hi this time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You said it, you’re still here.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: I miss you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was 15 years old when you walked out. Now you’re walking back in?

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: I left your mother. I didn’t leave you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mum was living on gin and tonics, how was I supposed to take care of her?

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: She wasn’t your responsibility.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know! She was yours.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: I’m sorry she died. I’m sorry you had to deal with that. But she was falling apart long before –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’ve got to talk to House about this treatment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But the patient’s getting better.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: In spite of the cytoxan.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On the other hand, getting better.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cytoxan makes him more susceptible to infection. The anthrax could relapse and be more resistant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want a negative test for every auto-immune disease known to man? Fine, I’ll get them!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Be home by midnight or he can’t have the car this weekend. You guys talk? Did he tell you why he’s here?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The SLE conference.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Going back to the conference?

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Afternoon panel. I hope I can stay awake.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hope you can get in. You’re not registered. I get it. You had to make up a lie. Can’t just tell your kid you’re here to see him. What father does that? That little blue dot under your collar. It’s a tattoo for guiding radiation treatment. I was looking for it after I saw what you had for breakfast: brown rice and vegetables, macrobiotic diet. Popular with Hollywood starlets and cancer patients.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Lungs, stage four.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You look good.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: I’m not. Came to the States to go to Sloan-Kettering, and to see Dr. Wilson.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What’d he say?

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Three months.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you haven’t told Robert. You don’t want to burden him because you were such a lousy dad.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: I’d prefer you not tell him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s better. I’ll get to see his face when he reads his dad’s obituary.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: It’s not your business.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I suppose it isn’t.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: You sure do a lot of tests.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If we figure out exactly which auto-immune condition it is, we can get you better quicker.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: Was that your dad before?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: That’s so cool. Do you guys work together a lot?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: When can I go home?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We’ll see. Looks like you got your appetite back. That’s a good sign. Want some water?

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Okay. Whoops. It’s all right. Water’s cheap.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: I can’t, I can’t move my hand.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Squeeze my fingers for me, Gabe?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s getting worse. Now his entire right hand and forearm are paralyzed.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: And his fever’s back, it’s back over 105.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If we don’t stop the nerve deterioration quickly, he’ll be paralyzed for life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, luckily, at this rate, that should only last about a week. Okay, so –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I told you we should get him off the cytoxan. This is toxic neuropathy. We’ve been shoving drugs into his system for a disease he doesn’t have!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know, it could be neurological.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What kind of brain process would cause a paralyzed hand, skin lesions, and swollen throat nodules?

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Robert was right. You said multiple neurofibromatosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you saying that for the chance of a beautiful family moment, or is there some medicine involved?

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Fits better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Too bad. I was hoping for the other reason. I was gonna go get my camera. Get a CT scan. His brain this time.

utterance.speaker: Blonde
utterance.content: You think three copies will be enough, right?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: One’s always been more than enough for me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why didn’t you tell me that Rowan Chase was in to see you?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Excuse me. Ethics, confidentiality? Does any of this ring a bell?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You could have covered yourself. Called me in for a consult.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It is a juicy piece of gossip. You know what happened? I got all focused on his cancer and lost perspective.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can’t tell Chase, but I can. What should I do?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh! This is where I give you advice and pretend you’re going to listen to it. I like this part. Did Rowan ask you not to tell?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I promised I wouldn’t. My fingers were crossed, though, so I’m wide open.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was wrong! This is the musing-out-loud part! Do I actually need to be here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Telling him, now that’s got real entertainment value.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hmmm, he might even cry. On the other hand, there is the “do unto others” thingy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then I should definitely tell him! I’d want to know.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You want to know everything. There’s also the “keeping your promises” thingy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you never run out of thingies. Like that blonde thing you were chatting up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She’s the hospital accountant! We were going over billing procedures!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Double-entry bookkeeping?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Billing procedures. They’re so complicated, aren’t they?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You know, parents are never as bad as kids think they are.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You like my dad so much, ask him out.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’d make an excellent step-mom, I’m very lenient. He’s your father, you never see him, and he’s here. Unless he’s done some unspeakable thing, you should lighten up.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Right, thanks for the tip.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Okay. He beat your mom. He beat you. What did he do?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Really, don’t push it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: All this hate. It’s toxic.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then stay away. There’s nothing there.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No masses, no fibrous tangles, nothing. It’s not neurofibromatosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Drs. Chase are 0 – 3. Even when they agree they’re wrong. So, next. What else could cause neural damage as well as all the nodules?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Burger’s disease.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He’s never been out of the country.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Have his parents? They could have brought it back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter. His lesions are in the wrong place, his feet are the one clear spot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kid’s dad mentioned leishmaniasis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, and filariasis, but the throat nodules still don’t fit with that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two diseases pretty much exclusive to Southeast Asia. What if the anthrax didn’t set off the second disease?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We’re back at coincidence again?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. What if something else was the trigger?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Nothing else happened.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We happened.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Antibiotics?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We’ve been through this, it’s not an allergy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ve gotta pee.

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: What did the CT scan tell you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On a scale of one to ten, how painful?

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: About half as painful as when I punch you in the face.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t do that. It’ll hurt you. Carpal tunnel surgery obviously didn’t work.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The little ones call me Uncle Gregg. Your dad never had carpal tunnel. You mentioned two obscure diseases to Dr. Chase. How’d you know about them?

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: I read about them on the internet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, what’d you search for? “Diseases from Asia that don’t match my son’s symptoms”? You heard about them in Asia.

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: I’ve never been there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you probably just forgot. Let me refresh your memory. Some remote, dusty village, close quarters, at least a year… starting to come back?

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: I’m calling Dr. Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Excuse me, what does this have to do with our son?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your dad’s pissed off. He should be. Comes here, expecting us to do an extra good job because he gives a whole lot of money to this hospital –

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: Don’t talk to my son like that!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just telling him my job, my obligation to this –

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Stop! What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There’s only one thing that you guys have got to do. Tell the truth, or your son will die. How long were you in Asia?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Jeff, it’s a simple question.

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: Two years, in India.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Why would you lie about something like that?

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: It was ’87 and ’88. This, uh, this guru, I thought he had some answers. I went to his ashram, and, um, ended up with no money and no answers. I was embarrassed, I didn’t want anybody to know.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: No. No, you were a test pilot.

utterance.speaker: Jeffrey
utterance.content: I’m so sorry, Gabe.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: What does this have to do with my son?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Clue number one: If I were Jesus, curing this kid would be as easy as turning water into wine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Demonic possession?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Close, but no wafer. Clue number two: Rheumatology Rowan was almost right. It causes auto-immune symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Leprosy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s real big in the Jersey suburbs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s leprosy. Run a FITE stain, it’ll be positive. Daddy hung out on the wrong kind of Indian ashram.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But it’s obviously dormant in the dad, how could the kid catch it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s not dormant in the dad, it’s just slow. Damaged his ulnar nerve, was misdiagnosed as carpal tunnel. Never trust doctors. Run a FITE stain.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: No wonder he got anthrax. The leprosy weakened his immune system.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Vicious circle. The leprosy made him vulnerable to the anthrax, and the anthrax treatment put the leprosy in overdrive.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But the antibiotics we gave him, they cure leprosy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s where the trouble starts. The antibiotics hit the nerve strands, they kill the leprosy bacteria. The corpses get tossed into the system. And as fascinating as our bodies are, they’re also stupid. They produce antibodies to beat dead bacteria. And these aren’t the polite antibodies, they’re the ones that won’t sit still; kick during naptimes. They attack his neural and fat cells, cause some inflammation and all the rest of his symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: So the cure’s killing him!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I want you to call down to Carville, Louisiana, home of the last leper colony in the lower 48. Get them to send up some thalidomide.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Thalidomide?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Twelve-year-olds don’t have sex, right? So he can’t be pregnant. Make the call. I need to speak to your boy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why does everybody need to know my business?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: People like talking about people. Makes us feel superior. Makes us feel in control. And sometimes, for some people, knowing some things makes them care.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’d tell you my dad left, my mum drank herself to death… you gonna care about me more?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cameron would. Me, I just like knowing stuff. I know you hate your dad, but I’m gonna tell you something –

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don’t hate him. I loved him until I figured out that it hurts a lot less to just not care. You don’t expect him to turn up to your football match? No disappointments. You don’t expect a call on your birthday, don’t expect to see him for months? No disappointments. You want us to go make up? Sink a few beers together, nice family hug? I’ve given him enough hugs. He’s given me enough disappointments.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That’s it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That’s it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Breathe. Breathe again. Breathe again.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: You gonna have to tell my friends I’m a leper?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You had the antibiotics. You’re not contagious any more.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: What if they already caught it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Leprosy is incredibly hard to catch. Even your mum didn’t get it. All right, I want you to make a fist.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: It’s still kinda stiff.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It’ll get back to normal in a month or two. Your skin, two or three weeks. You haven’t asked about your dad.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: He lied about everything. He lied to my mom. He lied to his boss. He’s just a liar.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He loves you.

utterance.speaker: Gabe
utterance.content: I don’t love him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, you do. Nothing you can do about it. He’s your dad. It doesn’t matter what he does, you’re gonna love him.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hey! When’s your flight? You got time for a drink?

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Wish I did.

utterance.speaker: Cabbie
utterance.content: Dr. Chase!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’ve got it.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: You’re going to be getting down to Aus any time soon?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not too long. Next autumn, I hope. I’ll call you. Well, you’re all set. I’ll see you.

utterance.speaker: Rowan
utterance.content: Yeah. I’ll see you.
